alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 7:25PM CST until February 28 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected Tuesday afternoon... .The combination of west winds gusting to 45 mph and relative humidity around 15 percent will create Critical fire weather conditions Tuesday afternoon across Cheyenne county Colorado, Wallace, Greeley and Wichita counties in Kansas. Outdoor burning should be avoided. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MST /1 PM CST/ TO 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ TUESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 027, 041, 042, AND 254... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon MST /1 PM CST/ to 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Tuesday. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Timing...Noon MST (1 PM CST) to 5 PM MST (6 PM CST). * Winds...West 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Temperatures...55 to 60 degrees. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
